channel.title: New PC
channel.description:
This is the PC I've just started to build. I have all the parts picked out, it's just a matter of coming up with all the money I need to buy the parts. I got the case so far. If there's anything you think I should change, I'm open to it, but I'm sure this is what I'll be going with in the end.
I chose what I did mainly because I want good performance while playing games, and second for graphics. The dual core is okay for now, if I really feel the need for a quad core, I can go that route if need be. I strayed away from liquid cooling just because I didn't want to deal with keeping the maintenance of it, that and I'm not too familiar with it.
I have one screen for now, but I may get two. I want to be able to run games, and also do some stuff (Music, IM, web browsing) on the other screen. Or run a program, and have a web browser on the other screen, instead of minimizing the program.
If it looks like I've screwed anything up(Which I'm fairly sure I haven't.) please share with me what it is.
http://secure.newegg.com/WishList/PublicWishDetail.aspx?WishListNumber=14554367

item.title: New PC
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:36, topic:260520”][quote author=sppt link=topic=344013.msg2663666#msg2663666 date=1234394511]

The n64 is probably the best console of all time, the Nintendo DS is awesome (it plays roms too!) and the Wii is cool too. The controls are actually very good I think.

You actually own a DS as well? That’s pretty cool.
I got one with a flashcart, and I play on it nearly every day since I bought it 2 years ago, I really love it.
[/quote]

Ashton (srt8) bought me one for Christmas, then I got the card for it so I can play roms. I’ve pretty much only played Zelda on it so far, got any hints for other good games? :)[/quote]
I really like the Ace Attorney series.
There’s 4 of them now, 3 featuring phoenix wright and 1 featuring apollo justice (see the pun there? the game is FULL of that).
Anyway, in the game, you’re an attorney, and you need to investigate the crime and try to get your client the not guilty verdict, it’s a pretty cool game, but it can be quite hard, but luckily there’s tons of humor in it.

Another game that I like is Professor Layton and the curious village.
In this game, you need to solve puzzles to get to the golden apple, it has a quite nice storyline and it isn’t boring like you’d expect. It also has ingame movies, which is pretty nice.

The World Ends With You is pretty nice too, it’s a bit anime-style graphic-wise, but the game itself is pretty good.
You’re dropped in some world, where you need to fight spirits (dunno if that’s the right name) and follow a certain objective.
After awhile you suddenly realise that you’re actually dead, and need to finish off the boss spirits if you want to be alive again.

A bit needless to say, but: get New super mario bros, 42 all-time classics (if you like card/board etc games) and Chrono Trigger, which is actually another remake of the game, but this remake is actually utilizing the features of the DS.

I’d also suggest you to check out some top-game lists on IGN or something, perhaps you’ll spot something nice

Read full topic

item.title: New PC
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:16, topic:260520”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=344013.msg2657006#msg2657006 date=1233942266]
I agree, I’ve got 1.75 TB in my desktop, and it is almost full.
[/quote]

What exactly do you fill it with? I asume with hd films and games but 1.75tb would still take a long time to fill.[/quote]

Mostly games, PC games, Wii games, console roms. I probably have less than 10gb of movies and about 8gb of songs.

Cruzer:

can never have enough hard drives

That is right, I only have 4 sata ports (all harddrives) and one IDE channel (1 hd and 1 dvd burner) and I don’t know what to do when I need another hd, probably buy a sata controller card.

Read full topic

item.title: New PC
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

ThAt0n36Uy:

The reviews I read on the stock heatsink and fan said it wasn’t very good. So I opted for another Heatsink/Fan combo.

The reviews were wrong, the stock heatsink/fan will keep it around 30C most of the time, less if you have good breathing in your case. However, if you want to get the extra stuff make sure the heatsink comes with thermal compound, or you will need that too.

Mopman:

As if it is, I could fill a tb pretty quick

I agree, I’ve got 1.75 TB in my desktop, and it is almost full.

Read full topic

item.title: New PC
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

RXVL:

and that PSU looks dodgy.

It has blue LEDS inside it!
The Drive-Bay box is pretty useless because the PSU has tidy-cables already

Moparisthebest:

Also, there is really no need for a seperate harddrive for windows and linux, get a cheaper, larger one, then partition it.

The confusing thing is that even if you were to use 2 hardrives 1tb is way to much
